channel.title: BondAngle on Mjolnir documentation
channel.description: Recent content in BondAngle on Mjolnir documentation

item.title: Harmonic
item.description: HarmonicPotential # Well-known and widely-used harmonic function. \[U(v) = k(v-v_0)^2\] Example # [[forcefields.local]] interaction = "BondAngle" potential = "Harmonic" topology = "bond" parameters = [ {indices = [0, 1, 2], offset = 100, v0 = 1.0, k = 100.0}, # ... ] Input Reference # k: Floating It determines the strength of the potential. v0: Floating It determines the native length.

item.title: Gaussian
item.description: GaussianPotential # The well-known, widely-used gaussian function. \[U(v) = k\exp\left(\frac{-(v - v_0)^2}{2\sigma^2}\right)\] Example # [[forcefields.local]] interaction = "BondAngle" potential = "Gaussian" topology = "none" parameters = [ {indices = [0, 1, 2], v0 = 1.0, k = -100.0, sigma = 5.0}, # ... ] Input Reference # k: Floating It determines the strength of the potential. If positive, the gaussian becomes repulsive.

item.title: FlexibleLocal
item.description: FlexibleLocalAngle # It represents angle distribution of flexible regions of proteins in a Coarse-Grained protein model. Since it represents a distribution, it is based on values on grid points and interpolates those values. It is a component of AICG2+ Coarse-Grained protein model. It is developed in the following paper. T. Terakawa and S. Takada, (2011) Biophys J. Example # [[forcefields.local]] interaction = "BondAngle" potential = "FlexibleLocalAngle" topology = "none" env.
